column2: SESSION 1 TRAINING
FIRST HALF OF THE WEEK - BRIEF SCENARIO TRAINING
TOPIC CONGRUENT - 10 SCENARIOS FOR EACH DOMAIN
Note: 1 scenario has to have a negative ending, 2 scenarios have to have a resilience ending
ACADEMICS
Scenario
column3: Second part (resilience)
column7: Comprehension Question
column9: Type of ending (positive, negative, or resilence)

column2: Today, you will receive an important call. You'll find out if you got the job you interviewed for. As you think about waiting for the call, your anxiety is
column7: Are you able to tolerate feeling anxious while waiting for the call?

column2: You decide to run for class president and you have to debate your fellow candidates in front of the school. The other candidates are on the debate team, and this is your first debate. When you think about arguing your position in front of your classmates, you feel
column7: Are you worried about the debate?

column2: You got caught breaking a rule at school. You didn't mean to, and know that the principal will need to call your parent. You walk into their office and feel
column3: You sit down and tell the principal what happened. As they dial the phone, you know that your parent will be
column7: Are your parents going to get mad?

column2: You've decided to get a job right after high school. All of your close friends are applying to college. When you think about your decision not to go to college right away, you feel
column7: Are you happy with your decision to get a job right after high school?

column2: Today your top college is emailing you about whether or not you were accepted. You have a few hours to wait until you'll get the email. When you think about waiting that long, you feel
column7: Do you feel OK having to wait for the email?

column2: It's your first day at a new school and it's lunch time. A group of students goes quiet after you ask them if you can sit at their table. They are probably
column7: Were the quiet students nice?

column2: Tonight is the night of parent-teacher conferences. You're not doing well in math, and you know your teacher will tell your guardian about your recent grades. When you think about what your guardian will say to you afterwards, you feel
column7: Can you handle your guardian's reaction to your math grades?

column2: Your report card has been handed out and you notice a few grades are lower than you normally get. Your parents are expecting good grades and they know that you're bringing the report card home this afternoon. While you're waiting to show your parents, you feel
column7: Are you spending the afternoon worrying about showing your parents your grades?

column2: You check online to see your latest spelling test grade. You see that your grade is a lot lower than you expected. You think about what this will mean for your overall grade, and know everything will be
column7: Will there be terrible consequences for getting a low grade on your spelling test?

column2: Your family expects you to go to college after high school. You haven't told them yet that you want to go to technical school. You think about telling them and feel
column3: You decide to tell them anyway. When you tell them your plans, you feel
column7: Do you feel better after talking to your parents about your plans after graduation?

column2: Great job with those scenarios in your domain! Now you'll get to practice a few more scenarios that are from other domains. This will help you apply your flexible thinking skills to lots of different types of situations!
You invited your caregiver to a school event tonight. You know that they can sometimes tell embarrassing stories about you to other people. You think about what they're going to do tonight, and feel
column7: Are you worried about what your caregiver will say tonight?

column2: You are on the local swim team. Your crush just joined and now they'll be able to see you in a swimsuit. You think about this and feel
column3: You remember that they will be focused on swimming and everyone else will be wearing swimsuits too. This makes you feel
column7: Do you feel okay wearing your swimsuit in front of them?

column2: You have a routine dentist appointment and find out that you need some tests to check the health of your gums and teeth. After the dentist performs the tests, you continue to lie in the dentist chair while waiting for the results. You think the news from your dentist will be that your gums are
column7: Do you think you have gum disease?

column2: You are taking a test in your environmental science class. You only have ten minutes left and you still have three long problems to get through. When you think about your ability to complete the test, you feel
column7: Will you be able to finish your test in time?

column2: Your friend enjoys ice skating and convinces you to try it out. At the rink you put on the skates and step on the ice. You glide forward slowly at first, then faster, and think your chances of getting injured are
column7: Are you excited to try ice skating?

column7: Will your friends judge your home?

column3: You know you made a babysitting commitment. You are happy that you are being
column7: Do you feel happy with your choice?

column7: Are your friends judging you for working?

column7: Do your friends judge you for what you said about the TV show?

column2: You are hanging out with some friends. One of them invites another one to come over to their house on a different day without you. You think about it and realize you feel
column7: Are you upset that you weren't invited, too?

column2: It's a warm day and you and your friends are taking a walk outside. You notice that you are starting to sweat, and you can see some marks on your shirt. You know these friends well, and they will not
column7: Will your friends make fun of your sweat marks on your shirt?

column2: You're at the thrift store with your parent and you're looking through the clothes. You notice two people from your school in the other part of the store laughing. They are probably laughing at a
column7: Are the other students from your school laughing at you?

column2: You are going on a date tonight. You don't know the person well and you know there will be some silences in the conversation. Even though it might be awkward, you know you'll have
column7: Are you able to cope with awkward silences?

column2: You started a new school this fall. Since classes are all online, you haven't been able to meet any of your classmates in person. You have seen some of them out and hanging out and feel
column3: You decide to take iniative and ask for their numbers. You feel
column7: Can you make friends with your classmates even though classes are online?

column2: You're talking to a group of your friends at lunch. You make a joke that you think is really funny, but no one really laughs. They were probably
column7: Did you say the wrong thing?

column2: PHYSICAL HEALTH
Scenario
column7: Comprehension Question
column9: Type of ending (positive, negative, or resilence)

column2: You decide to spin yourself really quickly on an office chair. You feel butterflies in your stomach and your head get dizzy as the chair slows down from spinning. These feelings probably mean that you are
column7: Are you worried about feeling dizzy?

column2: As you wake up in the morning, you sit up quickly. Your vision goes blurry, and then goes black for a moment. Your vision comes back after a moment, and you tell yourself that it happened because you sat up
column7: Does your momentary blurry vision mean that you are going blind?

column2: You finish a long run for gym class. You notice that your heart is racing very fast and your chest feels tight. You think you are about to
column3: You really want to go to the bathroom so that you're away from your classmates. You decide to stay in the gym and breathe
column7: Is it necessary to go to the bathroom because of your racing heart?

column2: You are at a birthday party for a friend of a friend. You start to feel a knot in your stomach while talking to someone you've never met before. This probably means that you are
column7: Are you worried about talking to a new person?

column2: It's Monday morning and you just finished running down the street to catch your bus. You feel your heart racing as you step onto the bus and sit down. Starting to sweat and breathe quickly, you fear that you might have a panic
column3: You have a strong urge to get off the bus and go back home, but you sit down at the nearest seat. Instead of exiting, you decide to observe these sensations and stay...
column7: Is it necessary to get off the bus because you feel your heart beating rapidly?

column2: You are taking a dancing class and, during a break, feel your legs go wobbly. You focus on these feelings as you get a drink of water. Wobbly legs probably mean that you are pushing
column7: Are your wobbly legs a sign that you are unwell?

column2: You are in the car with a parent and they are driving the speed limit on the highway. You feel butterflies in your stomach as you see cars passing quickly by. This makes you feel
column7: Do the butterflies in your stomach make you feel excited?

column2: You are about to audition for a play and you feel your body tremble. You don't usually feel this way when you perform in front of people. These trembling feelings mean that you are
column7: Do the trembling feelings mean that you are unprepared for the audition?

column2: You are talking to your parent about your day at school and suddenly you feel your throat go dry. You cough a little and reach for a glass of water. The water helps a little, and you realize that the dry throat was probably
column7: Does the dry throat mean that you are sick?

column2: You wear a shirt to school that hangs tightly around your armpits. In the middle of the day, you notice that you have sweat marks. After thinking about it, you realize that sweating throughout the day is
column7: Is sweating a normal bodily function?

column2: Your crush asks you about your social media accounts. You don't like social media, and have chosen not to have any accounts. Your crush will think that you are
column7: Does your crush think it's fine that you don't have social media?

column2: You meet a new student in biology who seems really cool. After school, they request to follow you on your private social media account. Before you let them follow you, you look over your own feed and feel
column7: Are you worried about what your classmate thinks of your profile?

column2: You can see that friend opened the photo you sent but didn't respond to you. You know that they're posting other things, so they're definitely on their phone. Your friend probably didn't respond because they
column7: Is your friend ignoring you on purpose?

column2: You and your friends are comparing scores on a social media app. You have a low score and your friends start teasing you. You begin to feel
column3: You don't use the app often and that's why your score is lower than theirs. You know your friends know this and they weren't trying to be
column7: Were your friends trying to make you feel insecure about having a low score on the social media app?

column2: You meet a new classmate in your online class and they ask you for your name on social media. When you tell them you don't have that app, they grow quiet. They must think that you are different, and that's
column7: Is it okay that your classmate thinks your different?

column2: A new dance is trending on social media. You and your best friend really want to make it, but it requires three people. You decide not to make the video since you do not have a third friend to make it with, and you feel
column7: Are you upset about not having a friend group of three people?

column2: You post a picture you are really confident about. You see a really rude comment as you go back to check your comments. You take a deep breath and decide not to feel
column7: Do you get really upset about the rude comment on your post?

column1: Your friend hasn't liked your post
column2: You posted a new picture a few hours ago. You check to see who's liked it and notice that your best friend hasn't liked it yet. You think about how your best friend doesn't check their feed often and you feel
column3: You look at who did like your photo, and notice other good friends have liked it. When you think about your best friend not liking your post yet, you are
column7: Is it okay that your bestfriend hasn't liked your post yet?

column2: You are trying to think of a good caption for your next post.You find a really funny one on a website after doing a quick search, but it's different from the captions you usually see on the app. Your followers will think that it's
column7: Do your followers like your caption?

column2: You see a new post on your social media app and realize some of your friends are hanging out right now. You don't remember being invited to hangout with them. You think about missing out on the fun, and think that you weren't invited because you are
column7: Did they exclude you because they don't like you?

column2: HOME LIFE
Scenario
column7: Comprehension Question
column9: Type of ending (positive, negative, or resilence)

column2: You invite your friend over after school and your parents are home. Your parents are pretty opinionated and may say something embarrassing to your friend. As you and your friend walk into your home, you are
column7: Are you anxious as you and your friend go into your home?

column2: You live with a few extended family members. Your friend asks if they can come over after school to study, and they don't know how many people live in your home. As you picture your friend coming into your home, you think they will be
column3: You consider that you live in a different situation compared to your friend. You also know that your friend is really nice, so will be
column7: Does your friend judge you for living with lots of extended family members?

column2: You and some friends are watching a movie at your home. At the end of the movie, your friend asks what that funny smell is. You know that's your dinner, and when you think about how to answer you feel
column7: Are you anxious about telling your friend that the smell is your dinner?

column2: Your friends ask you to go to a concert, but it's the night of an important cultural celebration for your family. You are looking forward to the celebration with your family, but don't want your friends to think you're lame. As you think about telling your friends, you realize that your culture is
column7: Are you embarrassed to tell your friends that you can't go to the concert?

column2: Your family shares one older car that has a big dent in the front. Today your parent has to drop you off at school because you are running a little late. When you think about your classmates seeing your parent's car, you feel
column3: As you're getting out of the car in front of the school, you see your group of friends. They smile and wave at you, and you feel
column7: Do your friends judge your parent's car?

column2: You want to go to college, no one in your family has gone to college yet. You think about how your family will react when you tell them your decision and they may not like the idea of you going to college. As you imagine telling them, you feel
column7: Are you worried about telling your family that you want to go to college?

column2: You invite your friend over for dinner, and while you're eating, your family switches back and forth between English and another language. You never told your friend that your family members are bilingual. You think about your friend's reaction, and think that she'll think it is
column7: Is your friend judgmental of your bilingual family?

column2: You have recieved a poor score on a test and your guardian has to sign off on it since the grade is low. They don't say anything when you show them your test. They are probably feeling
column7: Is your guardian disappointed that you got a bad grade?

column2: You have been invited to a friend's house for a holiday and you want to bring a gift, but can't afford to buy one. You decide to write a poem and recite it for their family. As you picture yourself reading it, you feel
column7: Are you worried about reciting a poem for your friend's family?

column2: Your neighbors were really loud last night so you couldn't sleep. You have a huge test this morning in your least favorite class. As you think about how you'll do on the test, you feel
column7: Are you ready for your exam?

column9: Type of ending (positive, negative, or resilence)

column2: You're watching a TV show about people travelling to other countries. The idea of taking an airplane makes you feel anxious. You think you will deal with your anxiety
column7: Are you able to tolerate your feelings of anxiety about airplanes?

column2: You are at a water park with a group of friends and everyone you're with wants to go on the tallest slide. As you climb the stairs, you look over the side and feel your stomach drop. You think that this ride will be
column3: You reach the top of the stairs and your friends go down the slide. Even though you're anxious, you go down the slide and
column7: Were you able to overcome your anxiety and enjoy the tall slide?

column7: Has your elder neighbor likely been sick?

column2: You get to school and realize that you are not wearing your lucky necklace. You don't remember taking it off earlier. You become a little anxious thinking about where the necklace is, and your day ends up being
column7: Is your day miserable while you worry about the necklace?

column2: At a picnic with family, you accidentally cut your finger while slicing fruit. Because you are outside, you are not able to wash it out immediately with soap and water. In a few days, your cut will be
column7: Are you worried the cut will become infected?

column7: Are you worried about completing the assignment?

column7: Will your neighborâ€™s house probably be robbed?

column7: Was there something scary outside in the dark?

column3: You notice that your guardian does not look upset while listening to the news. You think that things will be
column7: Should you start to worry about your guardian's job?

column7: Are you likely to get bitten by a poisonous snake?
